intro: Pancratium guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan yellow nutmeg, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and toxic alkaloids. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, well-drained soils. Its bulbous stem and lance-shaped leaves are adapted to its native environment. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
